solution_line_template: He planned on {sodas_per_guest} sodas per guest and invited {num_guests} guests so {sodas_per_guest}*{num_guests} =<<{sodas_per_guest}*{num_guests}={total_cans_needed}>>{total_cans_needed} cans of soda

Each pack of soda had {cans_per_pack} cans. He needed to buy {total_cans_needed} cans of soda for his guest so {total_cans_needed}/{cans_per_pack} = <<{total_cans_needed}/{cans_per_pack}={num_packs_needed}>>{num_packs_needed} packs of soda

The soda was on sale for ${cost_per_pack} per 6 pack and he was buying {num_packs_needed} packs so {cost_per_pack}*{num_packs_needed} = $<<{cost_per_pack}*{num_packs_needed}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} for soda
